page.title: 04Tourist Facilities in Hutton
page.content: Hutton-le-Hole, being a holiday area, tourism is second only to farming in providing occupation. There are two souvenir shops, a snack-bar, two small hotels,a public house and five private houses offer bed and breakfast accomm- odation in this very small village. Most of these are family concerns, though about three other people are employed. These catering establish- ments provide an abundance of coffee, teas and ice-cream,the latter seems to be the main attraction. Only the pub provides lunches and dinners. Hutton does not suffer much from litter and most visitors respect the country code, but there is some local feeling against the commercialization of the village. A large family house,owned by a Quaker foundation is used as a charity holiday home.
